standard_metadata.standard_description: Read, write, and compare decimals to thousandths.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Decimals on the number line: thousandths

question.content: **What is the value of the point graphed on the number line?**

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.02 to 0.04 with tick marks every one thousandth unit. A point labeled question mark appears eight tick marks after 0.03.

hints.content: The length between the labeled tick marks is $\blueD{0.01}$, or $\blueD{1 \text{ hundredth}}$.   Each $\blueD{0.01}$ is divided into $10$ equal pieces that have a length of $\goldD{0.001}$, or $\goldD{1 \text{ thousandth}}$.
The point is $\goldD{\text{8 thousandths}}$ after $0.03$.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.02 to 0.04 with tick marks every one thousandth unit. A point labeled question mark appears eight tick marks after 0.03. An arrow moves right along the number line, starting at the 0.03 tick mark and ending at the tick mark with the point labeled question mark.

hints.content: $0.03$ and $\goldD{ \text{8 thousandths}}$ equals ${0.03\goldD8}$.   Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths | $\goldD{\text{Thousandths}}$ :-: | :-: |:-: |:-: |:-:  $0$ | $.$ | $0$ |$3$ | $\goldD8$    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.02 to 0.04 with tick marks every one thousandth unit. The eighth tick mark after 0.03 is labeled 0.038.

hints.content: The value of the point graphed on the number line is $0.038$.

question.content: **Which point on the number line represents $0.087$?**

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.07 to 0.09 with tick marks every one thousandth unit. Point A appears at the seventh tick mark after 0.07. Point B appears at the third tick mark after 0.08. Point C appears at the seventh tick mark after 0.08.

hints.content: The length between the labeled tick marks is $\blueD{0.01}$, or $\blueD{1 \text{ hundredth}}$.   Each $\blueD{0.01}$ is divided into $10$ equal pieces that have a length of $\goldD{0.001}$, or $\goldD{1 \text{ thousandth}}$.
${0.08\goldD7}$ is $\goldD{ \text{7 thousandths}}$ to the right of $0.08$ on a number line.
Which point on the number line graphs $\goldD{ \text{7 thousandths}}$ to the right of $0.08$?    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.07 to 0.09 with tick marks every one thousandth unit. An arrow moves right along the number line, starting at the 0.08 tick mark and ending at the the seventh tick mark after 0.08.

hints.content: The following point on the number line graphs $0.087$:    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.07 to 0.09 with tick marks every one thousandth unit. Point C appears at the seventh tick mark after 0.08.

question.content: **Which point on the number line represents $0.024$?**

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.01 to 0.03 with tick marks every one thousandth unit. Point A appears at the fourth tick mark after 0.01. Point B appears at the tick mark labeled 0.02. Point C appears at the fourth tick mark after 0.02.

hints.content: The length between the labeled tick marks is $\blueD{0.01}$, or $\blueD{1 \text{ hundredth}}$.   Each $\blueD{0.01}$ is divided into $10$ equal pieces that have a length of $\goldD{0.001}$, or $\goldD{1 \text{ thousandth}}$.
${0.02\goldD4}$ is $\goldD{ \text{4 thousandths}}$ to the right of $0.02$ on a number line.
Which point on the number line graphs $\goldD{ \text{4 thousandths}}$ to the right of $0.02$?  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.01 to 0.03 with tick marks every one thousandth unit. An arrow moves right along the number line, starting at the 0.02 tick mark and ending at the the fourth tick mark after 0.02.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  The following point on the number line graphs $0.024$:

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.01 to 0.03 with tick marks every one thousandth unit. Point C appears at the fourth tick mark after 0.02.

hints.content: The length between the labeled tick marks is $\blueD{0.01}$, or $\blueD{1 \text{ hundredth}}$.   Each $\blueD{0.01}$ is divided into $10$ equal pieces that have a length of $\goldD{0.001}$, or $\goldD{1 \text{ thousandth}}$.
${0.06\goldD3}$ is $\goldD{ \text{3 thousandths}}$ to the right of $0.06$ on a number line.
Which point on the number line graphs $\goldD{ \text{3 thousandths}}$ to the right of $0.06$?  [[☃ image 1]]

question.content: **Which point on the number line represents $0.010$?**

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.00 to 0.02 with tick marks every one thousandth unit. Point A appears at the first tick mark after 0.00. Point B appears at the tick mark labeled 0.01. Point C appears at the first tick mark after 0.01.

hints.content: The length between the labeled tick marks is $\blueD{0.01}$, or $\blueD{1 \text{ hundredth}}$.   Each $\blueD{0.01}$ is divided into $10$ equal pieces that have a length of $\goldD{0.001}$, or $\goldD{1 \text{ thousandth}}$.
${0.01\goldD0}$ is $\goldD{ \text{0 thousandths}}$ to the right of $0.01$ on a number line.
Which point on the number line graphs $\goldD{ \text{0 thousandths}}$ to the right of $0.01$?  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.00 to 0.02 with tick marks every one thousandth unit. A point appears at the tick mark labeled 0.01.

hints.content: The following point on the number line graphs $0.010$:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 0.00 to 0.02 with tick marks every one thousandth unit. Point B appears at the tick mark labeled 0.01.

question.content: **What could be the value of the point graphed on the number line?**

images.alt: A number line from 0 to 0.1, labeled in steps of 0.01. A point between 0.03 and 0.04 is nearer to 0.04.

hints.content: The point is between $\greenD{0.03}$ and $\purpleC{0.04}$.   $\greenD{0.03} < {?} < \purpleC{0.04}$  We can also write the decimals to the thousandths place.  $\greenD{0.030} < {?} < \purpleC{0.040}$
$\greenD{0.030} < {0.072} \,\maroonD{\nless}\, \purpleC{0.040}$  So, $0.072$ is too much.
$\greenD{0.030} < {0.462} \,\maroonD{\nless}\, \purpleC{0.040}$   So, $0.462$ is too much.
$\greenD{0.030} < 0.037 < \purpleC{0.040}$  The value of the graphed point could be $0.037$.

question.content: **What could be the value of the point graphed on the number line?**

images.alt: A number line from 0 to 0.1, labeled in steps of 0.01. A point  is in the middle between 0.09 and 0.10.

hints.content: The point is between $\greenD{0.09}$ and $\purpleC{0.10}$.   $\greenD{0.09} < {?} < \purpleC{0.10}$  We can also write the decimals to the thousandths place.  $\greenD{0.090} < {?} < \purpleC{0.100}$
$\greenD{0.090} < {0.950} \,\maroonD{\nless}\, \purpleC{0.100}$  So, $0.950$ is too much.
$\greenD{0.090} \maroonD{\nless} {0.019} < \purpleC{0.100}$   So, $0.019$ is too small.
$\greenD{0.090} < 0.095 < \purpleC{0.100}$  The value of the graphed point could be $0.095$.

question.content: **What could be the value of the point graphed on the number line?**

images.alt: A number line from 0 to 0.1, labeled in steps of 0.01. A point between 0.07 and 0.08 is nearer to 0.07.

hints.content: The point is between $\greenD{0.07}$ and $\purpleC{0.08}$.   $\greenD{0.07} < {?} < \purpleC{0.08}$  We can also write the decimals to the thousandths place.  $\greenD{0.070} < {?} < \purpleC{0.080}$
$\greenD{0.070} < {0.780} \,\maroonD{\nless}\, \purpleC{0.080}$  So, $0.780$ is too much.
$\greenD{0.070} \maroonD{\nless} {0.027} < \purpleC{0.080}$   So, $0.027$ is too small.
$\greenD{0.070} < 0.072 < \purpleC{0.080}$  The value of the graphed point could be $0.072$.

question.content: **Which point on the number line represents $0.038$?**

images.alt: A number line from 0 to 0.1, labeled in steps of 0.01. Point A is  between 0.03 and 0.04 and is nearer to 0.04. Point B is  between 0.07 and 0.08 and is nearer to 0.07. Point C is  between 0.08 and 0.09 and is nearer to 0.08.

hints.content: The number $0.038$ is $38$ thousandths, which is between $\redD{30\text{ thousandths}}$ and $\purpleC{40\text{ thousandths}}$.  $\redD{0.030} < 0.038 < \purpleC{0.040}$
That is the same as saying that $0.038$ is between $\redD{0.03}$ and $\purpleC{0.04}$.
Which point is between $\redD{0.03}$ and $\purpleC{0.04}$?

images.alt: The same number line as above.

hints.content: Point $\blueD{A}$ represents $0.038$.

question.content: **Which point on the number line represents $0.059$?**

images.alt: A number line from 0 to 0.1, labeled in steps of 0.01. Point A is  between 0.04 and 0.05 and is nearer to 0.05. Point B is  between 0.05 and 0.06 and is nearer to 0.06. Point C is  between 0.09 and 0.10 and is in the middle.

hints.content: The number $0.059$ is $59$ thousandths, which is between $\redD{50\text{ thousandths}}$ and $\purpleC{60\text{ thousandths}}$.  $\redD{0.050} < 0.059 < \purpleC{0.060}$
That is the same as saying that $0.059$ is between $\redD{0.05}$ and $\purpleC{0.06}$.
Which point is between $\redD{0.05}$ and $\purpleC{0.06}$?

images.alt: The same number line as above.

hints.content: Point $\maroonD{B}$ represents $0.059$.

question.content: **Which point on the number line represents $0.084$?**

images.alt: A number line from 0 to 0.1, labeled in steps of 0.01. Point A is  between 0.04 and 0.05 and is nearer to 0.04. Point B is  between 0.04 and 0.05 and is nearer to 0.05. Point C is  between 0.08 and 0.09 and is nearer 0.08.

hints.content: The number $0.084$ is $84$ thousandths, which is between $\redD{80\text{ thousandths}}$ and $\purpleC{90\text{ thousandths}}$.  $\redD{0.080} < 0.084 < \purpleC{0.090}$
That is the same as saying that $0.084$ is between $\redD{0.08}$ and $\purpleC{0.09}$.
Which point is between $\redD{0.08}$ and $\purpleC{0.09}$?

images.alt: The same number line as above.

hints.content: Point $\greenD{C}$ represents $0.084$.
